document.heading: Commemorative Works on Public Space Amendment Act of 2000

history.narrative: Law 13-275, the “Commemorative Works on Public Space Amendment Act of 2000”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 13-697, which was referred to the Committee of the Whole. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 5, 2000, and December 19, 2000, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 16, 2001, it was assigned Act No. 13-570 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 13-275 became effective on April 4, 2001.
